answers.answer: I honestly didn't have any side pain. I had extreme swelling in my legs especially. It got to the point I could only stand or lay down because the action of sitting caused my thighs so much pain it felt like my skin was going to rip apart

Oh :( I don't have apt till the 19th but I've had 1+ protein since last apt about 2 weeks ago. Continuous headache, fluctuating g bp highest was 140/90. 2 weeks ago. And since last night a pain on my side right under my ribs & right shoulder.
Call your ob. Not everybody has the same symptoms with preclampsia. I didn't have any except high bp

Call your Ob the only symptoms I had was major swelling in feet and legs and floaties in my eye sight every now and then it was like I'd see little silver streamers floating around. Can never be to cautious

At my last apt he said we would monitor it as I'm only 16.1. He said if the protien is still there them we will consider a 24 hour urine and go from there. Just wasn't sure if I should wait or go in to emerg.

Any upper abdominal pain in the third trimester should be a concern for a person with preeclampsia or history of preeclampsia. It is the liver that is the concern with possible help syndrome which can happen with preeclampsia. The liver can essentially burst and cause death. I'd imagine that the pain would be specifically near the ribs but this issue is too serious to play guessing games...I have been told to rush like crazy to an er if I get upper abdominal pain because of my history of preeclampsia, eclampsia, and help syndrome.

Please try eliminating all sodium to the best of your ability. No eating out and only season your food with seasoning that doesn't have salt in it. Take a liquid fish oil from a good nutrition store in the AM and PM. Also get a powder for of magnesium citrate and take the maximum dose every night before bed. I had really scary labs come back around my 20th week. I was able to reverse EVERYTHING AND NOW I'm 37weeks with no preeclampsia at all! :-) Please give these things a try your baby and your body will appreciate it!

question: To mamas whom have had it. Where is the right side pain usually located?
title: Preeclampsia
